title: Why Trump keeps pushing debunked claim about Haitian immigrants
description:
University of Virginia Center for Politics director Larry Sabato explains why Donald Trump continues to push a debunked lie about Haitian immigrants at rallies and public appearances.

#trump #CNN #news 

Want to stay up to date on the dayâ€™s top stories? Sign up for CNNâ€™s 5 Things newsletter, and weâ€™ll give you the 5 biggest stories you need to know, videos people are watching, and more! transcript_str: The mayor of Springfield, Ohio, issued a public plea sayin We need help, not hate. This, as former President Donald Trump doubles down on a baseless claim that Haitian immigrants are eati And we're now seeing the real li that Trump's words are having on the Haitian community there. On Thursday, Springfield City Ha was forced to close due to a bom On Friday, elementary schools there were evacuated for a secon straight day because of threats. So how did this debunked rumor make its way into Trump's remark on the debate stage? According to the apolitical fact checking organization Newsguard, it appears to have started with a single post on a private Springfield, Ohio, Facebook page. And in it, the poster claims their neighbors daughter's frien missing card was found butchered and ready to be eaten by Haitian immigrant The poster says they've been tol that this is also happening to dogs, ducks and geese. Well, there is more. It's not clear when the post was but on September 5th, just days before the presidentia it went viral on. And within days and without any  proof, Elon Musk and vice presidential candidate Senator J Vance were repeating it. So did other Republican politici like Senator Ted Cruz and Congressman Jim Jordan and Congresswoman Marjorie Taylor GREENE. neo-Nazis were also a key driver in amplifying the rumor for mont Hate groups like Blood Tribe have been spreading hatefu rhetoric rhetoric about Haitian immigrants in Spri and earlier this summer. They carried rifles and swastika as they marched through downtown Springfield. And last month, Springfield. Springfield's mayor, rather, had police remove a member of Blood Tribe from a city commission meeting. I've come to bring a word of warning. Stop what you're doing before it's too late. Crime and savagery will only increase with every nation you bring in and with it. And public frustration and anger you sound threatening to use on the comments of police to go have it. Sure. I don't need to tell you. Just sound threatening if you go ahead and just peacefully be removed. These people didn't ask for this and they deserve better than to have to put up with violent unrest. Thank you. You're done. Thank you. Five days. That's all it took for a private post to go from Twitter to former President Donald Trump, repeating it on a global stage. Joining me to talk about this and other developments, Larry Sa He is the founder and director of the Center for Politics at the University of Virginia, and he is the editor of the book A Return to Normalcy The 2020 Election That Almost Broke America. Larry, great to see you. Nice to see you, Fred. All right. So I know that was you know, that was quite the journey that a rumor took and has caused significant damag and disruption in that community and beyond in so many ways. So, you know, why does the former president keep spewing lies? You know, these this information that is so continuously to be so because it excites his base. There is no issue like the borde for them. Even more than inflation, I think the border issue, immigration ge gets them up and raring to go and determined to reelect Donald And that is all that matters, fr to Donald Trump. We live partly because of Trump. We live in the post factual erro we're in which facts no longer matter, Fred. They don't matter. Whatever you can say, whatever people want to take in. Even if you present them with volumes of evidence that it isn't true or made up. I'm thinking of the big lie about voter fraud. It's okay because it serves a la partizan purpose. It supports the candidate they want to win and the end jus the means. Boy, we've made a lot of progress in human history, but we haven't made any progress And he's also doing it because s it is beneficial to him. Is that support growing? I don't think it's growing. I think the question is whether or not he can maintain the level of determination and e that his border police, in a sen his coalition, have generated over the years. Because at this point, I don't think it's very likely at all that Donald Trump is going to attract new voters or that he's going to expand his coalition, his chance of being elected agai depends entirely on his coalitio his supporters turning out in very large number And this is what gets their motor running. So while Trump is also, you know attacking migrants, immigrants, he's also coming under fire from some of his most staunch su for campaigning with far right conspiracy theorist Laura Loomer She is someone who is claimed on 11, was an inside job, posted a racist tweet about Kamala Harris this w She's been seen, you know, getting on and getting off his p on his campaign stop. So and he's he's trying to say, loo not necessarily advocating everything that she has to say. She's a strong person. She has her own beliefs. That's the closest he's coming to either condemning or condoning her. Well, he obviously, in maintaining his association with and including her on his plane and making public appearances wi has legitimized, at least to a certain degree, I think, a substantial degree, the wacky things that she has said over the years. Look, this is not new, Fred. He has done this since he came on the public scen He has appeared with far right conspiratorial people, some of which he has endorsed on first Twitter and then throug And, of course, he has an ally on at least some things with your o You know, if you do it over and  and you pay no penalty for it and in fact, you gain from it politically, if you're like Donald Trump, you're very inclined to do it ag and again and again. Okay. Meantime, his opponent, Vice President Kamala Harris, she's been campaigning in Republican leaning counties in battleground states as she reaches out to swing vote And she's also launching this campaign to mobilize Latino What do you make of her strategy and her efforts to grow support? This is so important. And Democrats have not done it to the extent that they should h for a long time. They ignore the rural areas and they'll say, well, there's not that many votes ther We're going to go hunting where the ducks are. Meaning they want to maximize th in suburbs and urban areas. That's fine. Maximize your vote, but you can also help your cause enormously just by showing voters you're interested in what they t and you want to help them with their problems. And when you go into these rural you're not going to win them. As you were saying a few minutes your correspondent was they're not going to win them. They know they're not going to w But what they can do is instead of losing them by 50 poi they can lose them by 45 points. And you say, well, that's pointl No, it isn't. When you add up those extra vote in all those small rural localit it actually enhances your chances for victory. Larry Sabato, we'll leave it there for now. Thank you so much, from the University of Virginia. Thank you for.

title: Springfield mayor responds to JD Vanceâ€™s claims about Haitian immigrants
description:
In a one-on-one interview with CNNâ€™s Dana Bash, Rob Rue, mayor of Springfield, Ohio, says there are no verifiable claims of Haitian immigrants eating pets and calls for peace and rest in the community. #CNN #news 

Want to stay up to date on the dayâ€™s top stories? Sign up for CNNâ€™s 5 Things newsletter, and weâ€™ll give you the 5 biggest stories you need to know, videos people are watching, and more! ['The Haitians are not the kind of people to commit there types of crimes they are being scapegoated by the Democrats. Trump will get to the bottom of it and you will find it is the mayor that has something to hide. It is a fact they do eat Cats.' 'You are a lousy mayor gaslighting your own citizens, what a jerk. You think all these American citizens are lying. That says it all,everything we need to know about you.' 'What would you expect a Democrat to say???' ... 'That's not the point.
Millions and millions of invested I'll egals = that's the point.' '@@hollyschitt The recorded complaint was on the non emergency line. You can listen for yourself. Chances are it was never investigated. Bottom line there's a massive amount of Federal funding behind the new residents. I have a feeling anyone honestly reporting and/or not slow walking complaints will be crucified by the media and most likely fired placed on administrative leave or not promoted. Lots of pressure is on this town right now. I wouldn't want to be on the payroll. Surely you can sympathize with the city employees at this point.' 'https://youtu.be/glOnDceqqJc?si=_3wpvHkHqxn6bRgl']
transcript_str: You just heard J.D. Vance repeat his claims about Haitian immigrants in Springfield, Ohio. I want to go live now to Springfield and talk to the mayor. Rob Roux, thank you so much for being here. I really appreciate it. We have a lot to get to, but I want to know first of all about what's going on at this time. Your schools, city buildings have been facing threats. The local college had to cancel events today. The immigrant community has been facing a lot of attacks. I want to just ask about how things are going broadly in Springfield right now. And then thanks. Thanks for having me on. it's it's just obviously a very difficult time. You know, we have been shined under a spotlight that is so bright that it's it's hard to see some of the things that we actually need to be focusing on. And that's been difficult for sure. But, you know, we're concerned about the security in our community and we're focused on that right now. And when you say you're concerned about the security in your community and focus on that, can you elaborate about what security threats? I mean, we know about some of the bomb threats at schools, hospitals, colleges. Is there anything else that you want to share? We've had three consecutive days of threats. Not, to myself personally, in our family, but, as well as, the other commissioners and some other, officials. So, it's, like I said, definitely a high stress time. that is just really difficult to handle right now. Yeah, I, I'm sure, what are the nature of the threats? Extremely negative and, you know, harmful and and just extremely disruptive. And does it is it specific to the allegations without evidence of eating cats and dogs? Is it more broadly about the Haitian immigrants? Can you be a little bit more specific? Well, I think it's you know, I think just because everything has stirred up so much, people are responding according to their own way. They respond. And a lot of it's unhealthy. you know, there's there's real concerns with what we're dealing with here prior to this whole spotlight that's happened. And, and we won't deny that there's been infrastructure strain. There has been, you know, it's just been, overwhelming at times. But we're trying as a community to lead well through this and put our arms around the situation. but what has happened in the last three days has caused a more significant strain on our community. I want you to listen again to part of what J.D. Vance told me this morning. My constituents have brought approximately a dozen separate concerns to me. Ten of them are verifiable and confirmable and a couple of them I talk about because my constituents are telling me firsthand that they're seeing these things. Mayor, they're your constituents as well, and you live in the community. Do you have any confirmed reports of Haitian migrants eating dogs and cats in Springfield? We do not. And I think you highlighted earlier on one of your interviews that, you know, we the sheriff's department did go back through the last 11 months and we just have no verifiable, claim that this is actually happened. We've had a complaint, was looked into and then we couldn't get I guess they couldn't call back and reach the person that made the complaint. You know, and would it would be helpful. You know, we are boots on the ground. We are here with our constituents. The governor of the state of Ohio, Mike DeWine, recognizes and trust the local officials to share the proper information and believes us. It would be helpful for those that are are, spinning Springfield into the swirl to understand that you can trust us. We are telling the truth to our community. We are not ignoring the strain that the immigration has put in our community, but we are here to try to put our arms around it and to work as peaceably as possible to, have our community secure and safe and and, thriving and moving forward, just like we have been over the last decade. 8000 new jobs have come to our community over the last ten years. We are a community that comes together and works together, and these are the things that we want to talk about. Springfield to the nation, not the things that we have to keep, telling the press. Like, hey, your pets are safe in Springfield, Ohio. They absolutely are. It's just it's it's crazy. I have to keep saying that. You said, people keep spinning things that aren't true. It's crazy. You have to keep saying that. And you said that Mike DeWine, the governor, has been very supportive not only of, this program and of, the Haitians in your community because you said that, a big part of the reason they are there is because there are jobs that employers need to fill, and they are filling those jobs. You didn't mention Senator Vance, who, of course, currently represents your community and your broader state in, the United States Senate. Have you heard from him directly? I have not heard from him directly. I believe somebody within his office has reached out to the city, more than once. so, I've not had a personal conversation, with either of the candidates or Vance and and and that's fine. what we do need is we need peace and rest in our community. We need to be able to focus on the concerns that we've had here, and also how we are moving forward as well. when you said something about governor Mike DeWine has been supportive of the program, governor Mike DeWine has been supportive of what we're going through and has helped us with resources, with coordinated efforts to, you know, help secure our community as any governor in any state should be looking after the cities in their communities. If there is help needed in the, local municipalities. when you were speaking to a local affiliate there, this week, you said all these federal politicians that have negatively spun our city, they need to know they're hurting our city. And it was their words that did it. You heard me mention that to JD Vance. and he denied responsibility for having anything to do with the threats that you just talked about that have been going on, over the last three days. What your response? So I said this earlier in another interview. It would be helpful if they understood the weight of their words and how they could harm a community like ours. Again, I say, the light has been shined so brightly that has caused people to not even see clearly. it's too bright and so, it'd be helpful to like, bring peace with the words that you're saying about communities like ours instead of unrest. We're listening to our constituents. We're not ignoring the problems. and, you know, we just appreciate more positive light for our community. Again, we're not ignoring the concerns. We just don't need such a bright, bright light shined in our community that's causing unrest and and the lack of peace. Okay. And I also just want to say that the governor was was on another program today. And governor DeWine. And he said that people need to stop talking about eating dogs and cats. I'm guessing based on what you just said, you agree with that? 100%. I mean, it's it's it's a rumor that has been debunked. It is even the person that posted, the the initial, you know, cat situation has said that, you know, it was not true. It it was not was it was very poor taste in judgment to do it. But they admitted it and I appreciate that. Mayor Roo, thank you so much for coming on. I can't even imagine how difficult it is. You are a mayor of a very small town, and, you have a lot on your plate. The way you describe that bright spotlight is, is really telling. Thanks for coming on and appreciate it. Thanks for your time.

title: Trump, Harris face off at the ABC News Presidential Debate

title: Springfield, Ohio, man reported Haitian migrants snatching geese out of park just 2 weeks ago
description:
A Springfield, Ohio, resident on his way to work called 911 to report spotting four Haitian migrants snatching geese near a city park just two weeks ago, according to a newly revealed recording.

The call to a Clark County Sheriffâ€™s Office dispatcher, obtained by the Federalist, appears to support a viral claim about some members of the migrant community eating animals in city parks.

Former President Donald Trump blasted the story into the mainstream Tuesday night when he claimed migrants in Springfield were â€œeating the dogs.â€

â€œIâ€™m sitting here, Iâ€™m riding on the trail, Iâ€™m going to my orientation for my job today, and I see a group of Haitian people, there was about four of them, they all had geese in their hand,â€ the caller told a dispatcher.

He said the group â€” two men and two women â€” were each clutching one of the birds when they took off in a gray Toyota Tacoma truck. The caller gave a portion of their license plate he was able to make out.

Read more at https://nypost.com/2024/09/11/us-news/springfield-ohio-man-reported-haitian-migrants-snatching-geese/

#ohio #migrants #animals

title: 'You think this is the last cup of B.S.?': Steele slams Trump campaign for lying about migrants
description:
Springfield, Ohio city manager says he told Sen. JD Vance's staffer that the rumor of Haitian migrants eating pets was "baseless." NBC News' Ali Vitali reports more. Former Clinton campaign manager Robby Mook and former RNC chairman and MSNBC host Michael Steele join Chris Jansing to react.

I want you to take a listen to his response. To denounce the bomb that's in Springfield, Ohio. I don't know what happened with the bomb threat. But we know that the surge of Haitian migrants in Springfie that most of them are actually here legally and they have temporary protecte The other part of that, though, is that he claims he doesn't know anything about these bomb threats. However, on Friday, during a press conference in Los a reporter asked him specificall about these bomb threats. He dismissed the claims and then went on to say that actually the bigger problem is immigration. Now, I want to be very clear her about these claims about these m taking pets and eating them. We have now heard from the mayor of Springfield, the police chief of the city, as well as the Republican governor of Ohio. All of them saying that there is no evidence to support these claims that both Donald Trump and his running mate continue to We actually heard Donald Trump f bring it up publicly at the debate earlier t but they have continued to talk about this. Now, when I talk to advisers close to Donald Trump and people some of his allies, they argue that even if these rumors end up being untrue, proven false, they say at least people are talking about them. So keep that in mind. It really is trying to play in to that rhetoric we have become so accustomed to about Donald Trump trying to stoke fear about undocumented immigrants in this country Jessica. All right, Alina Treene reporting on the trail in Las Ve Thank you so much for that. Joining us now is CNN senior pol analyst and senior editor at The Atlantic, Ron Brownstein. Ron, good to see you. I know you have written extensiv about the issue of immigration. What do you make of of Springfie becoming this flashpoint in this issue right now? Well, look, I think it is giving Americans a very clear preview of what a second Trump term would be like in multiple respec The winking and violence that we in that answer, you know, without a clear denunc of these bomb threats, similar to the message he is sending with his promises to pardon the January some of the January 6th rioters  declaration that they've been tr very unfairly. And public opinion is remarkably consistent. They want order at the border. They want the laws to be respect But they are also practical and  There has you know, there has not been maj There has consistently been majority support for allowing people who have bee for an extended period of time, who have not committed any crime to transition to legal status. At some point, the discontent over Biden's management of the b has increased. Support in the public for some of these more draconian solutions that Trump is putting forward. 'Johnathan Swift, the fellow who wrote Gulliver's Travels, also wrote a piece of political satire about the British tyranny of the Irish, during a time of national Irish famine.\r
\r
Those, presumably on the side in favor of tyranny and famine, kept complaining that the Irish were lazy, didn't want to work, and were criminals and thieves just by their nature. Those people often happened to also be British.\r
\r
Swift wrote a short piece (a couple of pages long), saying that one good idea for a way to put the Irish to useful work, was to take their babies, ...and eat them. And then he spent awhile writing out cooking recipes.\r
\r
Swift was also British. But he was a deacon of the church. And most importantly had a soul.\r
\r
He was trying to point out to his lords and masters, the absurdity (see reductio ad absurdum) of the awful way they were treating the Irish.\r
\r
His lords and masters (also being British, as previously mentioned), didn't see it that way. They were really, really upset with him. I forget exactly how they excommunicated him and/or otherwise ruined him. But they did.\r
\r
The Irish (who did not have Internet access, or other means of fact-checking at the time, ...1500's-ish?, ...1600's?, ...I forget, look it up) were of the opinion the he (being also British, as was also previously mentioned) really meant it. And plotted to murder him. Several times over. Which, thank heaven, never did take place.\r
\r
And Swift was, ...joking (!?).\r
\r
Trump, and that sleaze-ball Vance (who knows better and is doing it anyway), are using the trope of people cooking and eating loved ones as a way to single out a group, dehumanize them, and try to make us hate them. I mean, really have hatred for human beings.\r
\r
It's not the first time it's ever been tried.\r
\r
That way we can become so full of road-rage level red-in-the-face anger that we are no longer able to think clearly.\r
\r
He's been shot at twice, and he hasn't once said anything about responsible gun ownership. All we get is Vance telling us about his 90 year old grandmother on her deathbed with 15 guns squirreled away around the house so that she'd always have a firearm within reach. That's what we get from these people after the first assassination attempt on their own guy.\r
\r
And we forget to remember the issues. Lowering inflation (which is coming down, slowly but surely), good jobs with benefits (the UAW, and God willing, maybe the Teamsters). All we can think about is having those fascist-wannabes commuting to show up in that small, dear town in the mid-West, desperately trying to do the right thing and make ends meet).\r
\r
Btw, once those newcomers get and keep jobs*, they will pay taxes, which will increase the revenue base, and then there'll be more-or-less enough money to pay for public services. *If it's done right.\r
\r
But Trump is doing that deliberately. Because he's slipping a point or two in the polls, and he is desperate not to lose this election and be held responsible for the real, genuine crimes that he has committed.\r
\r
Everything he has done so far (up to and including Jan. 6th) has been for that reason. Not for you or me. Or America. Or Liberty. Or Freedom.\r
\r
...Just for himself. So that he can stay out of jail.\r
\r
Folks just get sick and tired of all this stuff after so much of it from these people, all the bloody time.\r
\r
We need Freedom. ...From tyrants. That is how this whole "American Experiment" started. Freedom from tyranny.\r
\r

transcript_str: for such a small and usually quiet Midwestern Town Springfield Ohio has received an outside share of attention this past week many in the town's proud haian Community almost all of them in the United States legally tonight are fearing for their livelihoods and their lives since baseless claims about crime and the killing of pets began to spread the town's police its mayor the state's Republican Governor all say that none of these claims are true our senior National correspondent Terry Moran is in Springfield tonight they are living in fear here the community of Haitian migrants in Springfield Ohio and they tell us they're afraid to leave their homes haian people they they scared to go out because they afraid about their life their safety and all that in this town of almost 60,000 people threats of bombings and shootings have forced the closure of schools and City buildings for days Wittenberg University here has canceled all activities on Sunday and classes switched to Virtual learning on Monday out of an abundance of caution James fluon a member of the Haitian community help and support center says the fear comes from the bizarre and according to City officials here false stories Amplified by prominent politicians including former president Donald Trump in Springfield they're eating the dogs the people that came in they're eating the cats they're eating they're eating the pets of the people that live there I know some parents like for this period of time they trying to keep their children home like by the time they see how things going to be like wait for a couple of weeks to see if things going to come down or if things going to escalate you see that's why like some parents they don't even send their children to school like for this week I pressed the former president on Friday in California the mayor of Springfield Ohio the police chief the Republican governor of Ohio have all debunked this story about people eating pets and now there are bomb threats at schools and kids being evacuated why do you still spread this false Story the real threat is what's happening at our border radio host molito Jerome helped the new diaspora live in part to keep Haitians in the community informed but also to bridge the different cultures that now exist in Springfield and he says despite the hate that's been directed at Haitians by Outsiders the local community has come together to support their businesses but we can actually try to save Springfield right and right now in South leston you have um you know local raising going to Rose restaurant since that was beautiful last you know weekend pretty much to go to eat and it's packed and Ohio's Republican Governor Mike dwine on ABC's this week tried to knock down the stories calling them garbage this discussion just has to stop we need to focus on moving forward and not dogs and cats being eaten it's just uh ridiculous but all that hasn't stopped the harmful rhetoric Republican vice presidential candidate and Ohio Senator JD van says the story about people eating pets has worked even if it's not true the American Media totally ignored this Stu until Donald Trump and I start talking about cat means if I have to I to create stories so that the American Media actually pays attention to the suffering of the American people then that's what I'm going to do Dan it comes from firsthand accounts from my constituents I say that we're creating a story meaning we're creating the American Media focusing on it Springfield's Haitian Community comprises the majority of the influx of 12 to 15,000 migrant an to the area in the past four years with hopes for stability safety and jobs many of these Haitian migrants fled their country which is ravaged by Gang Related violence and poverty to come to the US some are protected under the federal government's temporary protected status designation Ohio is on the move and Springfield has really made a great Resurgence with a lot of companies coming in these Haitians came in to work for these companies they're very happy to have them there and frankly that's helped the economy Terry Moran thank you

title: Reporter Presses JD Vance About 'Debunked False Claims' About Haitians In Springfield, Ohio

title: Criminal charges filed by Haitian nonprofit against Trump and JD Vance
description:
Criminal charges were filed on Tuesday against Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump and his running mate Sen. JD Vance in relation to rumors of Haitian immigrants eating pets in Springfield, Ohio.

The charges were filed by Guerline Jozef, leader of nonprofit Haitian Bridge Alliance on the group's behalf under an Ohio statute that allows private citizens to file criminal charges. The charges claim that numerous threats in the city over the past few weeks strained local resources and city services.

Full story: https://abc6onyourside.com/news/local/haitian-nonprofit-files-charges-against-trump-and-vance-claims-harassment-haitian-bridge-alliance-clark-county-ohio

title: 'NO DOGS OR CATS' Haitian immigrant pleads with Trump and Springfield, Ohio residents
description:
Haitian migrants, Haitian immigration, Haitian refugees, Haiti migration crisis, Haitian asylum seekers, Haitian diaspora, US immigration Haiti, Haiti border situation, Haitian migrant stories, Haitian immigrant experiences, Haiti to USA journey, Haitian refugee camps, Haitian migrants in Chile, Haitian migrants in Florida, Haitian migrant rights, humanitarian aid for Haitians, Haitian community support, natural disasters in Haiti, political instability in Haiti, Haitian migration trends.

The claim was based on a number of online reports that had gone viral in recent days. Springfield has seen a significant increase in the number of Haitian migrants arriving in the town, sparking complaints from a number of local residents.

Among those claims are a number of unsubstantiated reports that migrants have eaten ducks or pets. One claim appears to be based on an incident in Canton, Ohio, where a woman had allegedly eaten a cat â€” but there was no indication she was Haitian.

In response to a query from Fox News Digital, local officials pushed back against the claims surfacing online.

"In response to recent rumors alleging criminal activity by the immigrant population in our city, we wish to clarify that there have been no credible reports or specific claims of pets being harmed, injured or abused by individuals within the immigrant community," the city said.
Republican vice presidential nominee JD Vance on Thursday stood by past remarks calling Haitian migrants who have entered the U.S. through a Biden-era parole program or who are protected from deportation "illegal aliens" â€” amid an ongoing debate about migration into the U.S.

Vance was asked at a campaign event about why he was referring to migrants from Haiti in towns like Springfield, Ohio, as "illegal aliens" when many of them have come in through the parole processes for Cubans, Haitians, Nicaraguans and Venezuelans (CHNV) or are protected from deportation via Temporary Protected Status (TPS).

"The media loves to say that the Haitian migrants â€” hundreds of thousands of them, by the way, 20,000 in Springfield, but hundreds of thousands of them all across the country â€” they are here legally."

"And what they mean is that Kamala Harris used two separate programs, mass parole and Temporary Protected Status. She used two programs to wave a wand and to say, we're not going to deport those people here," he said. "Well, if Kamala Harris waves the wand illegally and says these people are now here legally, I'm still going to call them an illegal alien. An illegal action from Kamala Harris does not make any alien legal. That is not how this works. "

The CHNV parole processes were expanded by the Department of Homeland Security in 2023 to allow up to 30,000 migrants from those four countries into the U.S. each month if they are vetted and have a supporter already in the U.S.

Meanwhile, the Biden administration redesignated and extended TPS for Haiti last year, offering protection from deportation and work permits for hundreds of thousands of Haitians â€” even those in the country illegally.

Republicans have objected to the use of parole programs by the Biden administration, both the CHNV program and the use of the CBP One app at ports of entry to allow in 1,450 migrants per day via parole. They argue that Congress has limited the use of parole to a "case by case" basis for urgent humanitarian reasons or significant public benefit, and that use of parole in such quantities is a breach of that. Republican states sued over the CHNV program this year, but they have lost in court.

title: Trump falsely claims Haitian migrants are eating pets in Ohio
description:
Former President Donald Trump falsely claimed Haitian immigrants are "eating the dogs" and pets in Springfield, Ohio, during the presidential debate Tuesday night. A city spokesperson told CBS News there have been "no credible reports or specific claims" of pets being harmed by immigrants. CBS News chief Washington correspondent Major Garrett has the details.

DONALD TRUMP SAID WHEN YOU LOOK  AT THIS, MILLIONS AND MILLIONS  OF PEOPLE  POURING INTO THE  COUNTRY WHILE THEY PRAY 21  MILLION PEOPLE.  WE'VE GONE OVER THIS.  DURING THE BIDEN ADMINISTRATION  HAD RECORD NUMBERS OF BORDER  CROSSINGS.  8 MILLION TOTAL.  NOT ALL OF THOSE ARE  INDIVIDUALS.  MANY OF THEM WERE SENT ACROSS  AND CROSSED AGAIN.  IS NOT 8 MILLION INDIVIDUALS.  SECONDARILY, NEVER IN THE BIDEN  ADMINISTRATION DID EVEN 1  MILLION PEOPLE GET ENCOUNTERED  IN ONE MONTH.  THE BIGGEST NUMBER WAS 300,000.  WE RATE THAT AS FALSE.  ONE THING THAT CAME UP FROM  VICE PRESIDENT HARRIS, TALKING  ABOUT  FORMER PRESIDENT TRUMP'S  FUTURE PLANS TO PLACE TARIFFS   ON CHINESE IMPORTED GOODS AND  IMPORTED GOODS FROM OTHER  COUNTRIES.  SHE SAID IT WOULD COST UP TO  $4000 MORE PER YEAR.  ECONOMISTS VARY.  THE RANGES ARE $1600-$3200.  SOME ECONOMISTS WILL SAY IT'S  AS HIGH AS $4000.  THE CBS CONFIRMED TEAM RATE AS  PARTIALLY TRUE.  NEEDS THE LARGER CONTEXT OF HOW  HIGH THE TARIFF WOULD BE AND  WHAT THE BOTTOM LINE EFFECT  WOULD BE A MIDDLE-CLASS  FAMILIES

title: JD Vance claims on Ohio's Haitian immigrants eating pets debunked
description:
Ohio Sen. JD Vance, Donald Trump's running mate, has amplified a claim apparently made online alleging Haitian immigrants in his state are abducting and eating pets. The CBS News Confirmed team reached out to local officials to corroborate the claims.

title: JD Vance defends amplifying false claims about immigrants
description:
Sen. JD Vance of Ohio, the Republican nominee for vice president, on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" defended his spreading of false claims about Haitian immigrants in his home state. "You're never going to get this stuff perfect," he said.

"Face the Nation" is America's premier Sunday morning public affairs program. The broadcast is one of the longest-running news programs in the history of television, having debuted Nov. 7, 1954, on CBS. Every Sunday, "Face the Nation" moderator and CBS News senior foreign affairs correspondent Margaret Brennan welcomes leaders, newsmakers, and experts to a lively round table discussion of current events and the latest news.

When it comes to the working class, we can look at the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act of 2017. His handling of the COVID-19 pandemic was another critical failure. By downplaying the virus and pushing for quick reopenings, he prioritized the economy over public health. Letâ€™s also examine his immigration policies. These rollbacks disproportionately affected low-income and minority communities, increasing environmental injustices that can lead to serious health issues. \r
When you consider all of these points together, itâ€™s evident that Trumpâ€™s presidency had lasting, tangible impactsâ€”not just politically, but socially and economicallyâ€”affecting real peopleâ€™s lives. title: Residents in Springfield, Ohio react to accusations of immigrants abducting and eating pets
description:
Former President Donald Trump has amplified false rumors that Haitian immigrants in Ohio are abducting and eating pets. It's another instance of the anti-immigrant rhetoric Trump has used in his campaigns.

Officials say thereâ€™s no evidence that Haitian immigrants in Springfield, Ohio, are abducting and eating pets.

But during a debate with Vice President Kamala Harris, Trump on Tuesday night mentioned Springfield.

He said immigrants are taking over the city and â€œthey're eating the pets of the people that live there."

Rose-Thamar Joseph, an employee at the Haitian Community Help and Support Center said that Haitian families living in the area have called her office and are scared.

"Some of them are talking about leaving Springfield. Some of them are scared for their life," Joseph said.

Sophia Pierrilus, a Haitian woman and immigrant advocate living in Columbus, said it's all political. "My view is that I think that's their way to use Haitian(s) as a scapegoat to bring some kind of chaos in America, because I don't see the reason why you should pinpoint a ethnicity and calling them certain names."

Pierrilus said many of the Haitians who have come to Springfield are professionals. "They are just looking for a way to integrate properly for them to actually use their skills for the benefit of America, not their country."

"I would have loved to see more of our local governments to step up and say something about this. I would love to see more of our federal governments to step up and say something. I would love to see more of our leaders, local leaders, Haitian leaders, African Americans to say something, because I'm watching," she said.

Officials have said they've seen no evidence of the claims that Trump and his allies are using to fan racist stereotypes about Black and brown immigrants. 

Harris called Trump's comment â€œextreme."

Long-time Springfield resident Chris Hazel said that he's familiar with the neighborhoods, including the park, where the pet and goose abductions were supposed to have happened. He called the idea "preposterous," because Springfield is "a community that loves the animals."

"It reminds me of when people used to accuse others and outsiders as cannibals," he said. "It's almost, it's dehumanizing a community, and saying the Haitians, as opposed to my neighbor, that just paints the picture."

Chantal Hutchinson, a Springfield resident, said the new Haitian population has put pressure on existing social services in the city. "You know, now I see more Americans homeless and without jobs, without money, without housing. Even families with little children, and I feel like that should be addressed."
